result.execSummary:
The defendant Glen D. Pipkin Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.    
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
May not have contact with victim. DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  14CF1116/15CF25.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Sentencing arguments made.  

15CF25 - deft sentenced to 6yrs WSP; initial confinement of 3yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Credit for 79 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  

14CF1116 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year consec to 15CF25.  Probation conditions to be identical to the ES conditions.  

Appeal rights.
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Case adj to 3/27/15 @ 9am along w/15CF25.
Sentencing hearing on March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Terry Rose.  Case is resolved.  School enhancer dismissed on State's motion.  Deft pleads guilty to the charge as amended; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 2/2/15 @ 2pm.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Terry Rose. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 12-3-14 @ 2:10pm. Jury selection on 1-5-15 @ 9:00am. Def. filed pro se bond motion and Atty. Rose argues for bond modification. State waives notice requirement. Bond amended to $500 signature bond with the same conditions. Amended bond signed in court.
